maml:description.maml:para: Used to show help about this 3CX XAPI Module.

3CX XAPI Module for managing PBX data. These scripta connect to the 3CX API (XAPI) to fetch and handle data. They use authentication credentials (XAPI Client ID and key/secret) to retrieve data from a specified PBX server (URL). The results are returned in JSON format and displayed in a structured manner, and export it to CSV/XLSX if necessary.
NOTES - This script requires PowerShell 5.1 or 7.5+. Other versions are not supported. - Requires `.psm1` modules for common functions. - Parameters '-user', '-key' and '-url' are required, please replace their values with valid API user, key/secret, and 3CX URL. - The '-top' parameter limits the number of records fetched. - The '-skip' parameter allows skipping records for pagination. - When supported by endpoint date range will include both the starting and the ending date (-from and -to values).
Excel export notes: - Most scripts include export of data to Excel XLSX file format. - "ImportExcel" module is required for XLSX export and can be found here: https://github.com/dfinke/ImportExcel - Ensure that the ImportExcel module is installed and imported in your PowerShell session. You can install it using the following command: Install-Module -Name ImportExcel -Scope CurrentUser - After installing, import the module: Import-Module ImportExcel - In case that ImportExcel module is not available, XLSX export will be skipped, while CSV export remains as alternative format.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Getting detailed view of help file for Get-ActiveCalls command.

maml:description.maml:para: Used to access ActiveCalls from the 3CX XAPI endpoint.

This function connects to the 3CX XAPI and retrieves a list of currently active calls. It requires authentication credentials and PBX URL. The results are returned in JSON format and displayed in a structured manner.
Provide API user/client ID used for authentication.
Provide API key (Client secret) used for authentication.
Provide full 3CX PBX URL, including protocol and port, such as https://YourSubdomainHere.3cx.eu:5001
Provide a number of records to skip for pagination.
Provide a number of records to fetch. NOTE: Parameter '-top' should not exceed 100 on this endpoint.
Provide API user/client ID used for authentication.
Provide API key (Client secret) used for authentication.
Provide full 3CX PBX URL, including protocol and port, such as https://YourSubdomainHere.3cx.eu:5001
Provide a number of records to skip for pagination.
Provide a number of records to fetch. NOTE: Parameter '-top' should not exceed 100 for some reason.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Skipping 150 records, then getting next 50 records.

maml:description.maml:para: Used to access ReportAbandonedQueueCalls from the 3CX XAPI endpoint. The '-queuedns' parameter is required and must be equal to extension number of the requested queue.

Used to access ReportAbandonedQueueCalls from the 3CX XAPI endpoint. It requires authentication credentials and PBX URL. The results are returned in JSON format and displayed in a structured manner. The '-queuedns' parameter is required and must be equal to extension number of the requested queue.
Provide API user/client ID used for authentication.
Provide API key (Client secret) used for authentication.
Provide full 3CX PBX URL, including protocol and port, such as https://YourSubdomainHere.3cx.eu:5001
Provide ISO 8601 Zulu date/time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
Provide ISO 8601 Zulu date/time format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ
Provide a number of records to fetch
Provide a number of records to skip for pagination.
Provide extension number of queue. NOTE: The '-queuedns' parameter is required and must be equal to extension number of the requested queue.
